From his first days in Marshall, Missouri, the music of Bob James has captivated audiences throughout the world. In 2022, Bob James released the album â€˜Feel Like Making Live!â€ to rave reviews, and James' 2023 album, 'Jazz Hands', was been Nominated for a 2024 GRAMMYÂ® Award for "Best Contemporary Instrumental Album"! AMAZING!!

He honed his skills working with Creed Taylor, working on albums for artists like Hank Crawford, Grover Washington, Jr, among others. While with CTI, James found great popular success overseeing significant hits for Paul Simon, Neil Diamond, Maynard Ferguson, and Kenny Loggins.

ğˆğ§ ğŸğŸ—ğŸ•ğŸ’, ğ‰ğšğ¦ğğ¬ ğ«ğğœğ¨ğ«ğğğ ğ¡ğ¢ğ¬ ğšğ¥ğ›ğ®ğ¦, 'ğğ§ğ', ğ°ğ¡ğ¢ğœğ¡ ğ¥ğšğ®ğ§ğœğ¡ğğ ğš ğ¥ğ¢ğŸğğ¥ğ¨ğ§ğ  ğœğšğ«ğğğ« ğ¨ğŸ ğ«ğğœğ¨ğ«ğğ¢ğ§ğ  ğšğ§ğ ğ©ğğ«ğŸğ¨ğ«ğ¦ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğ¥ğ¢ğ¯ğ. After three more albums, James began his own label, Tappan Zee Records. This allowed James to spend more time in the studio, focusing on his own creative works. It was during this time that he recorded his own Gold-Selling album, 'Touchdown', which included his composition, â€œAngelaâ€, the instrumental theme from the sitcom Taxi, and possibly Jamesâ€™ best known work. Bob composed all the original music used in that television series for its entire run!

ğ‰ğšğ¦ğğ¬â€™ ğšğ¥ğ›ğ®ğ¦, 'ğğ§ğ ğğ§ ğğ§ğ', ğ­ğ¡ğ ğŸğ¢ğ«ğ¬ğ­ ğ¢ğ§ ğ­ğ¡ğ«ğğ ğœğ¨ğ¥ğ¥ğšğ›ğ¨ğ«ğšğ­ğ¢ğ¨ğ§ğ¬ ğ°ğ¢ğ­ğ¡ ğ„ğšğ«ğ¥ ğŠğ¥ğ®ğ ğ¡, ğ°ğ¨ğ§ ğš ğ†ğ‘ğ€ğŒğŒğ˜Â® ğ€ğ°ğšğ«ğ ğ¢ğ§ ğŸğŸ—ğŸ–ğŸ ğŸğ¨ğ« "ğğğ¬ğ­ ğğ¨ğ© ğˆğ§ğ¬ğ­ğ«ğ®ğ¦ğğ§ğ­ğšğ¥ ğğğ«ğŸğ¨ğ«ğ¦ğšğ§ğœğ", ğšğ§ğ ğ¡ğšğ¬ ğ¬ğ¨ğ¥ğ ğ¨ğ¯ğğ« ğš ğ¦ğ¢ğ¥ğ¥ğ¢ğ¨ğ§ ğœğ¨ğ©ğ¢ğğ¬. During this time, James set the standard for the smooth jazz sound in the late 1970s. In 1985, James moved to Warner Bros Records, and kicked things off with 'Double Vision', a collaboration with David Sanborn. 'Double Vision' was another GRAMMYÂ® Award-Winner, selling over a million albums.

ğ–ğ¡ğ¢ğ¥ğ ğ«ğğœğ¨ğ«ğğ¢ğ§ğ  ğ¡ğ¢ğ¬ ğšğ¥ğ›ğ®ğ¦, 'ğ†ğ«ğšğ§ğ ğğ¢ğšğ§ğ¨ ğ‚ğšğ§ğ²ğ¨ğ§' ğ¢ğ§ ğŸğŸ—ğŸ—ğŸ, ğ‰ğšğ¦ğğ¬ ğ«ğğ®ğ§ğ¢ğ­ğğ ğ°ğ¢ğ­ğ¡ ğ¥ğ¨ğ§ğ ğ­ğ¢ğ¦ğ ğŸğ«ğ¢ğğ§ğ, ğğ«ğ®ğ¦ğ¦ğğ« ğ‡ğšğ«ğ¯ğğ² ğŒğšğ¬ğ¨ğ§, ğ‰ğ«. ğˆğ­ ğ°ğ¨ğ®ğ¥ğ ğšğ¥ğ¬ğ¨ ğ›ğ ğ­ğ¡ğ ğŸğ¢ğ«ğ¬ğ­ ğ­ğ¢ğ¦ğ ğ‰ğšğ¦ğğ¬ ğ°ğ¨ğ®ğ¥ğ ğ°ğ¨ğ«ğ¤ ğ°ğ¢ğ­ğ¡ ğ ğ®ğ¢ğ­ğšğ«ğ¢ğ¬ğ­ ğ‹ğğ ğ‘ğ¢ğ­ğğ§ğ¨ğ®ğ«, ğšğ§ğ ğ›ğšğ¬ğ¬ğ¢ğ¬ğ­ ğğšğ­ğ¡ğšğ§ ğ„ğšğ¬ğ­. This would be the start of something beautiful, as these early sessions ignited a spark which would engulf the Jazz world as FOURPLAY. Fourplayâ€™s first album was recorded and released in 1991, entitled 'Fourplay', sold over a million copies and remained at the #1 position on the Billboard Contemporary Jazz Chart for 33 weeks. Their next album, 'Between the Sheets' (1993), reached #1, went Gold, and received a GRAMMYÂ® Award Nomination. In 1995, their third gold album, 'Elixir', also reached the #1 position and remained on the chart for more than 90 weeks. The group would collaborate until 1998 when Ritenour left and Larry Carlton took over. This version of Fourplay continued the groupâ€™s huge success for seven more albums. After 12 years, Carlton decided to delve further into his solo career, and the band brought in guitarist Chuck Loeb in 2010.

ğ‰ğšğ¦ğğ¬ ğœğ¨ğ§ğ­ğ¢ğ§ğ®ğğ ğœğ¨ğ¥ğ¥ğšğ›ğ¨ğ«ğšğ­ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğ¨ğ§ ğ¬ğğ©ğšğ«ğšğ­ğ ğ©ğ«ğ¨ğ£ğğœğ­ğ¬ ğ°ğ¢ğ­ğ¡ ğ„ğšğ«ğ¥ ğŠğ¥ğ®ğ ğ¡, ('ğ‚ğ¨ğ¨ğ¥' ğ¢ğ§ ğŸğŸ—ğŸ—ğŸ) ğšğ§ğ ğŠğ¢ğ«ğ¤ ğ–ğ¡ğšğ¥ğ®ğ¦ ('ğ‰ğ¨ğ¢ğ§ğğ ğ€ğ­ ğ­ğ¡ğ ğ‡ğ¢ğ©' ğ¢ğ§ ğŸğŸ—ğŸ—ğŸ”). Both albums were Nominated for GRAMMYÂ® Awards. His solo career continued throughout the 90â€™s, culminating with 'Joy Ride' in 1999, garnering him another GRAMMYÂ® Award Nomination.

ğˆğ§ ğŸğŸğŸğŸ, 'ğƒğšğ§ğœğ¢ğ§ğ  ğğ§ ğ­ğ¡ğ ğ–ğšğ­ğğ«', ğ°ğšğ¬ ğ«ğğ¥ğğšğ¬ğğ, ğ¨ğ§ğœğ ğšğ ğšğ¢ğ§ ğ¬ğ¡ğ¨ğ°ğœğšğ¬ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğ‰ğšğ¦ğğ¬â€™ ğœğ«ğğšğ­ğ¢ğ¯ğ ğ¯ğğ«ğ¬ğšğ­ğ¢ğ¥ğ¢ğ­ğ². The album includes performances with Keiko Matsui, Joe Sample, Dave Holland, and Chuck Loeb. Fourplay released 'Heartfelt' in 2002, and spent much of the year touring across the globe. That same year, James released 'Morning, Noon, & Night', whose title track went to #1 in Contemporary Jazz Radio.

ğ‰ğšğ¦ğğ¬ ğ¬ğ­ğšğ²ğğ ğ›ğ®ğ¬ğ² ğ¢ğ§ ğŸğŸğŸğŸ”, releasing 'Urban Flamingo' in February, and on April 7, was awarded the "George Benson Lifetime Achievement Award" by the Canadian Smooth Jazz Awards. Summer saw the release of Fourplayâ€™s tenth record, appropriately called 'X'. This tour literally took James around the world again with stops in Spain, London, California, Hong Kong, Japan, Kuala Lumpur, and Indonesia.

ğˆğ§ ğŸğŸğŸğŸ–, ğ‰ğšğ¦ğğ¬ ğ«ğğ¥ğğšğ¬ğğ ğš ğ‚ğ¡ğ«ğ¢ğ¬ğ­ğ¦ğšğ¬ ğšğ¥ğ›ğ®ğ¦ ğ°ğ¢ğ­ğ¡ ğ‡ğ¢ğ¥ğšğ«ğ² ğ‰ğšğ¦ğğ¬, ğšğ§ğ ğšğ§ğ¨ğ­ğ¡ğğ« ğ…ğ¨ğ®ğ«ğ©ğ¥ğšğ² ğšğ¥ğ›ğ®ğ¦ 'ğ„ğ§ğğ«ğ ğ²'. 'Energy' featured GRAMMYÂ® Award-Winner Esperanza Spalding, and another GRAMMYÂ® Award Nomination with the first single, â€œFortune Tellerâ€.

ğˆğ§ ğŸğŸğŸğŸ, ğ­ğ¡ğ ğŸğŸğ­ğ¡ ğ…ğ¨ğ®ğ«ğ©ğ¥ğšğ² ğšğ¥ğ›ğ®ğ¦ ğ°ğšğ¬ ğ«ğğ¥ğğšğ¬ğğ, 'ğ‹ğğ­â€™ğ¬ ğ“ğ¨ğ®ğœğ¡ ğ­ğ¡ğ ğ’ğ¤ğ²', which led to another world tour, culminating with an unforgettable collaboration with the New Japan Philharmonic in Tokyo in December. Then, in September 2011, 'Altair & Vega', the Four-Hand piano duet collaboration with Keiko Matsui, was released. Their unique collaboration, which took nearly 10 years, resulted in several memorable live tour performances, before being completed as a recorded album, along with a live performance DVD recorded at the Manchester Craftsmenâ€™s Guild. Later that same year, James released a collaboration with Savannah guitarist Howard Paul with 'Just Friends: The Hamilton Hall Sessions'. All this, while still touring with Fourplay, including headlining the Playboy Jazz Festival at the Hollywood Bowl, and receiving the Oasis Contemporary Jazz Award for "Group of the Year".

The album hit the charts, producing several successful tracks, including the powerful â€œPut Our Hearts Togetherâ€, which featured vocals by Seiko Matsuda. The song was a tribute to the regions of Japan devastated by the natural disasters just months earlier, and spawned several benefit concerts, such as the Iwate Jazz Festival, and a full-length documentary of Jamesâ€™ visit to the region.

ğˆğ§ ğŸğŸğŸğŸ‘, 'ğğ®ğšğ«ğ­ğğ­ğ­ğ ğ‡ğ®ğ¦ğšğ¢ğ§ğ' ğ°ğšğ¬ ğ«ğğ¥ğğšğ¬ğğ, this was the first creative collaboration between keyboardist-composer Bob James and alto saxophonist David Sanborn since their million-selling, GRAMMYÂ® Award-Winning album, 'Double Vision', twenty-five years ago. In 2015, Jamesâ€™ first live album was released, 'Live at the Milliken Auditorium', which was captured on a magical night in his hometown of Traverse City, Michigan. This same year also brought the first release from James and longtime collaborator Nathan East, 'The New Cool', a masterful work of art which truly redefines the essence of cool.
